video.title: JavaScript Modules Past & Present
video.description:
Modules provide structure to our code, grouping related data and functionality into reusable building blocks. However, prior to ES6, JavaScript did not have a built-in module system. This month's meetup will explore the history of modules through the advent of ES Modules, the first standardized module system for JavaScript.

Talk given by Mejin Leechor at the JavaScriptLA meetup.

Thanks to JavaScriptLA for giving us permission to post this talk. freeCodeCamp is not associated with this talk. We're just excited to bring more exposure to to it!

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: Joachim Rosenberger
topLevelComment.text: Thanks! Great talk. Just starting learning js, comming from Python and C++. I've been really confused about Modules in js before. Thanks again.

topLevelComment.author: Orville Chomer
topLevelComment.text: I like getting context, it helps me understand a subject. This did just that. I saw it yesterday and I like the why's and how's covered not just merely  copy and paste recipes with little to no understanding of what its doing.  Thanks!

topLevelComment.author: Seth Wilson
topLevelComment.text: The history of modules is really helpful and adds some good perspective on this topic.
